IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To develop and implement programs and to support policies that increase access to community based primary care for the uninsured and underserved patients in the City and County of San Francisco.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To develop and implement programs and to support policies that increase access to community based primary care for the uninsured and underserved patients in the City and County of San Francisco.
IRS990.Desc: Offerred guidance and training support and implemented program and information technology to improve the quality and access to care delivered to SFCCC member clinics and SOS Vans uninsured and underinsured patients.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part II-B, Line 1i - Other Activities Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization uses various staff from time to time to influence legislation

The Organization is not classified as a private foundation and is exempt from federal and state income taxes under the provisions of Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3) and California Revenue and Taxation Code Section 23701d respectively. The Organization is considered a publicly supported organization. The Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) interpretation No. 48, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes, subsequently included in the FASB codification as ASC 740 prescribes a recognition threshold and a measurement attribute for financial statement recognition of tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return. Management has considered its tax position and believes that all of the positions taken by the Organization in its federal and state exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. The Organizations returns are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities, generally for three and four years respectively after they are filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SFCCC has policies and procedures in place to monitor the use of all grant funds. Each sub-recipient agency is vetted to ensure that agency meets all the governing and operational requirements as defined and outlined by each grantor. SFCCC conduct periodic assessments and reviews audited financial statement from each sub-recipient to confirm the sub-recipient is properly using award funding and qualifies as a low-risk grantee. The monitoring policies and operational procedures are review and approved by the SFCCC Board of Directors, on an annual basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: According to the Organization's By-Laws each member clinic has a representative in the governing body and is entitled to elect one or more members of the governing body.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is prepared by an outside licensed professional and is reviewed by the VP of Finance and Communications, Maria Powers.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation and terms of positions of CEO is evaluated every year by the Board, his contracts have been negotiated every five years. The compensation of Chair/CEO and VP of Finance and Information is monitored annually

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annual Board review of management performance.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Total non-cash contributions received by the organization was $177,727. Of this amount, $117,271 represented donated use of facilities and volunteer services,$4,684 represented use of rent storage and parking and $55,772 represented donated medical and program supplies. Only the donated medical and program supplies have been reported on line 1g and in Schedule M as per the instructions. The donated services and use of facilities & rent storage and parking have been reconciled in Schedule D, Part XII, Line 2b & Part XIII, line 2a.
